title: Telephone appointments
body: I have waited a long time for my latest discussion. I was given a date - 2nd August - to receive a call (at 10.00am). I waited in for 12 hours (8am - 8pm) but did not receive a call. No apology, no explanation. I tried calling the appointments line today, hung on for 45 minutes, got through and was then cut off. Obviously, not very happy.

title: Colonoscopy - Great Care
body: Having done a bowel screening test l was sent a referral for a colonoscopy. From the initial appointment with an amazing nurse who reassured me and booked my colonoscopy for the following week to the actual day of the procedure l can not fault a single member of staff, unfortunately l suffer with white coat syndrome however every member of the team did their utmost to try and keep me as calm as possible I can only thank everyone involved with my care.

author: mercurydf76
title: High Blood Pressure
body: I visited the Surgery to see the nurse about my blood pressure. My medication was increased after the elevation of B/P was confirmed by the Nurse. The nurse and the consultation were both good and there is nothing I feel that could be improved,

author: UnknownZilla
title: Exceptional nurse
body: Went for a blood test and waited about 3 minutes maximum! When i went for the actual test the nurse was exceptional. I've never had my blood taken and it be so gentle. I know I'll be going back to her for future blood tests!!!

title: Terrible communication
body: Admin staff talk to me as if I’m beneath them and not worth their time of day. It comes across from nearly all staff that as a patient with additional needs I am seen as being difficult on purpose. There are two great Drs I’ve seen who genuinely have empathy and are sensitive to my needs but the rest of the staff have been awful. I don’t intend to make a complaint as doing this in the past about another issue has led to punitive care. There needs to be a way of patients being able to communicate with the practice manager where there are persistent issues. I’ve been trying to arrange a meeting for three years but this has been refused.

title: Terrible, just terrible!
body:
I don't think they actually have any doctors on site, it is impossible to see one. Phantom doctors and horrendously abrupt and rude receptionist(s). Robotic answers: no appointments available, call at 08:00, goodbye!

If possible - avoid!

title: So unsafe
body:
I called at 8am on the dot for an appointment because I have a breast lump!! 
I waited on hold today for an appointment for 58 minutes and only to be told you don't have any appointments and i cannot pre book for another day,
They do not even offer e consult anymore 
I work as. A clinician in a Gp surgery so cannot cancel on patients and drop everything for the rare appointment they do have to offer with no flexibility! 
I called for. A breast lump because I’m scared I have cancer and desperately need to be seen! 
Absolutely pathetic! Hope CQc shut it down! It’s already rated inadequate

title: Secretary Line
body:
Why is it when you call during the day, the Secretary Line is either closed or transfers you to a mailbox that's full and then cuts you off?  How are you supposed to speak to anyone at the surgery? 

Still waiting on Fit to Exercise notes since request on 7th July 2023!!!

title: Overall Experience
body:
I had the most amazing midwives during my birth, I was induced and the midwife was nothing but supportive throughout and was completely led by me but also I felt I was able to tell my midwife how I wanted them to react in a certain situation. I tried to give birth naturally for 12hrs before an emergency c section and the care I received from my midwife was absolutely amazing. The second midwife took over for her shift and supported me through the c section, she was reassuring and extremely calm. The theatre team and doctor who delivered my baby were extremely calm throughout the c section, explained absolutely everything, played my selected music and ensured I was informed of what was happening the whole way through.
I couldn’t have had a better experience and they all got my baby here safe.

I also had to be readmitted after I was discharged due to my baby having jaundice, the wards were amazing and supported me through the night when needed hands on or just advice when asked, no hesitation. When it was time to be discharged the midwife and the NICU nurse, despite being extremely busy on the ward, supported to get me home as I requested that same night with all of the meds, advice and care I needed.

Please feel free to share this review with the midwives that looked after me, you can email me if you need any more information in order to find them.

title: Waited 3 days and then 3 hours
body: Opened Livi app 7am Wednesday and had appointment booked for 10.30 Saturday. Sat in front of screen for 1.5 hours from 10.15 Saturday . No doctor assigned until about 13.15. Finally doctor called me just before 13.30, nearly 3 hours later. She was very nice and helpful and also explained that the ‘appointment time’ is not actually a time and more the start of you ‘waiting in line’. She said this should be made clearer and I fully agree!

title: Very helpful, excellent service.
body:
A sudden non-emergency health problem with which I needed assistance was reported at ca, 14.30, by 16.00 I was seeing the most professional and understanding paramedic and getting all the help I 
needed . Finally signed off by duty doctor.
A very fine experience - Most impressed.

title: Great practice
body: I recently used the on line service for advice within a very short period of time I received a call back from the surgery who gave me clear and concise advise also gave me an appointment to see one of their team a hour later.I  received a warm and helpful welcome from reception within minutes  of arriving I was seen by a member of their medical team who had a professional and very friendly way. Thankyou

title: CT Scan good experience
body:
Arrived early for 6pm appointment to hear people moaning about waiting times. By 6.05 I had been fitted with a cannula by a very pleasant young man who noted my fear of needles and put me at ease. I had to keep drinking water but the machine was broken and staff had to keep filling two jugs. They apologised but this added to their workload. 
Management please take note.
The complainers had now disappeared.  Within 15 mins I was called into a room for my scan which involved pumping a saline solution into my arm and filling my bladder before resting for ten minutes. The radiographer explained how I would feel and never left me alone in the room keeping me informed.
I only waited about five minutes before the cannula was removed gently. Thank you. Much appreciated. 
Also appreciated my previous phone conversations with the urologist and his secretary when I was concerned about my holiday insurance cover. All staff were helpful and friendly.
Perhaps signage near the hospital entrance could me more prominent as reception was unmanned at that time. A nurse leaving her shift pointed me in the right direction - down the stairs.

title: Great practice
body: Very kind and helpful and understanding was very happy with everything that was done . Made me feel reassured and at ease and relaxed

title: Excellent Service
body:
My aunt has been ill for some time and became bed bound abour 2 years ago.  The practice could not have been more helpful accommodating and friendly.  I have on several occasions had to have the doctor / paramedic out to my aunt and they have always been prompt, thorough and have explained her condition and medication in detail.  I have nothing but praise for the staff from reception right through to the doctors and medic.
Sadly my aunt passed away but may thanks to all at Rushall Medical Centre

title: Good service shouldn’t be needed the way I…
body: I was told by my own gp that I could have a phone call a full week away from when I needed an appointment and if I needed anything else I should go to the walk in centre. So I went to the walk in centre at this gp practice and was seen by a doctor within an hour who prescribed emergency antibiotics while I waited to see my own gp. Great that we have this facility but we shouldn’t be in a situation of having to use it because you can’t see your own gp.

title: Friendly staff great experience
body: The doctor was so nice and explained what was happening I felt relaxed and safe. Couldn't of had better service

title: Beyond expectations
body:
I had a very fast appointment following my referral . Everyone was professional, Caring , Extremely knowledgeable & spent time explaining the investigations done & the plan of care.
Again I had an appointment bud at the first visit to rtn for surgery in just over 2/52 time .
Again the care & experience of all the staff was excellent I felt cared for safe & reassured throughout the procedure.

title: Excellent therapist at Mind Matters.
body:
I have had a 10 session CBT treatment program with Mind Matters for PTSD. I had experienced a traumatic event in October 2022 falling 40 meters down a ravine in Snowdonia and was finding it difficult to move on. I was experiencing nightmares and flashbacks and ruminating about the accident and the injuries that I had sustained. I was unable to get back to normal life and work and feeling increasingly isolated as I avoided social situations where I might be asked about the accident.

My therapist was excellent. She explained to me the process of Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) in a way that was easy to understand. She was empathic, kind and patient, which is so necessary when emotionally vulnerable. She allowed me time to discuss my concerns. 

As part of the CBT, we practiced 'Reliving’. With my eyes closed and talking in the first person as if I was experiencing the fall for the first time, I talked about what had happened to me. I also recorded it. Although distressing, I was given encouragement and a longer session to do this in a safe manner. Both my therapist and I identified a list of hotspots that had caused me distress. We then went through a structured plan, about what I was thinking at the time, what I feared would happen to me, what the real outcome was, and how I could remind myself of this real outcome. I thought about these points as I listened to the tape again many times. 

This process was extraordinarily helpful. Up until then intrusive frightening thoughts and memories of the event would jump out and derail me at unexpected times and would often keep me awake. Breaking down the traumatic event into sections allowed me to process what had happened to me in a logical way. Initially I felt overwhelmed when listening to my recording, but with time this lessened to the point that eventually the tape even became boring!

I found myself coming to terms and processing and accepting what had happened to the point that it became a memory, rather than something that intruded every day.
 
Unfortunately, during the last few weeks of treatment I experienced another near-death traumatic incident. I am quite sure that the skills I learnt during my therapy that I applied during this trauma, kept me calm and contributed to my 8% chance of survival.  I am indebted to my therapist at Mind Matters.

I am also sure that with this second trauma I can use the skills that I have learnt to prevent me getting PTSD from this event. 

I have also learnt so much about myself through this process. I have learnt to be kind to myself and look forward positively about the things I can do, rather than the things that I now can't. These skills will help me to embrace an optimistic and positive future, something that in my darkest hour I never thought I would achieve again.
I cannot recommend Mind Matters more. I am so lucky to have been treated with such professionalism, kindness, and empathy, thank you so much.

title: Great practice
body: Attended with hubby Chris,im 78 and was nervous. No need to be,your terrific staff were great.Every one of them was welcoming and friendly.I cant praise them all enough...thank you all so much.A definite 5 star...wish i could give you all more!

title: Amazing Experience
body:
From my first visit to my discharge,the whole experience at The Harbour Hospital has been excellent.
The Team looking after me were attentive, professional and friendly.
Many thanks for your excellent service.

title: Waste of time
body: My Dr's is always so busy so decided to use their Livi app but over this week appointments have been cancelled and rescheduled 3 times at the time of appointment. Very disappointed I will now need to try and make an appointment with the surgery

title: A bad experience
body: For the 1st time at New Mill Street surgery have I had a poor experience where I felt patronised and not heard nor listened to. Any healthcare provider's education begins with communication skills. I have always felt lucky to be a patient at this practice until today.

title: Excellent Practice
body: Friendly, helpful reception staff working under enormous pressure.  I’ve never had a problem getting an appointment when needed.  The GPs and nursing staff are kind, empathetic, helpful and really give the personal touch during appointments.  I would 100% recommend this doctor’s surgery.

title: Great practice
body: Overall efficient when reporting at reception.When I had my face to face with the Nurse she gave me a really comprehensive explanation as to my current medical situation.I felt that she listened to my responses & I went away feeling positive.

title: Signs of improvement
body:
Visited the surgery on a few occasions lately.
Latest visit, made an appointment for annual review, received notification via text message with a link to make appointment, very simple and straightforward.  Staff on reception are helpful and been pleasant.  Contacting by phone can be frustrating. Nurses and Doctors very good

title: Always had caring experience
body: When seeing nurses about swollen legs, they commented on my laboured breathing and sent for the on-call doctor. She gave me an ECG and took a blood test. Early next morning my GP contacted me and sent me to the R D & E hospital where I was diagnosed with  blood clots on my lungs.  I was kept in overnight, having been prescribed a  warfarin type drug which has cured the problem. Their prompt attention may have saved my life. I cannot be more grateful.

title: Mri Scan
body: Every member of the team, including the reception staff, was very helpful, informative, and polite. I was given all the information needed for my procedure via paper before hand and spoken word whilst I was there at the clinic. Very happy with my visit

title: Good experience
body:
A very friendly, competent practice 
Lovely atmosphere lovely staff 
Prompt attention in good manner 
Would recommend.

title: Very happy with treatment
body: I have been very impressed with treatment of a recent issue - won't go into my personal details here but initial diagnosis and appointments for blood tests, ultrasound tests at a separate clinic and further GP contacts have all been very speedily arranged. GP has been very understanding of any concerns of mine and acted to reassure me. Couldn't ask for more. First rate!

title: Not fit for purpose
body: After waiting over 40 minutes to see a consultant oncologist they refused to see me and walked off in a huff.Not up to the job some of the people in this department.Now seeing another consultant on time who could not be nicer with excellent staff around them,that says it all does it not.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Friendly, efficient service
body:
I attended the surgery for a GP check of a lump, and the following day I returned for some blood tests and routine cervical screening. 
Each of the people I interacted with (receptionist on telephone, receptionists in person, locum GP, HCA, nurse) was friendly, professional, efficient, listened to my concerns and questions. I would 100% recommend College Green.

title: Highly efficient
body: Just over a week after a GP referral I had an appointment. Without any waiting time I met the consultant, had my problem diagnosed and got my prescription within an hour of arrival at the hospital. My NHS treatment was brilliant. Thank you.

title: No service at all.
body: Nobody ever answers the phone, when you go down to make appointments in person reception want to know everything about your condition before giving appointments weeks away. Different gp every time who are just not interested and are more concerned staring at their computer screens than talking to you.

title: Rude and uncaring
body: Staff on reception are really rude , I get anxious about speaking to them as I don’t like conflict. I got issued the wrong prescription so was told to come in to speak to the prescription clerk, when I got there they told me the prescription clerk was upstairs, I’m disabled so couldn’t do the stairs, they eventually phoned and asked the prescription clerk to come down saying “yeah she’s apparently disabled so can’t do the stairs “ whilst laughing. She then said the clerk doesn’t have time to come down so you’ll have to phone up and get another appointment to ask for the right prescription. I decided just to go without the medication from now on as I always leave feeling worse than I was. Staff need to understand that we are human and understand the harm it causes being rude and dismissive to patients.

title: If only I could see a GP
body: I have been registered here for many years, but these days I have all but given up trying to make an appointment. When I try online, I get offered a telephone consultation, sometimes, if I'm lucky, but often nothing is available in the next 16 week period (?!) and nothing before. The last 3 times I booked a phone appointment, they called at the wrong time and them it's back on me to start over.  Try calling - and you can either not get through, or you just get berated by a rude receptionist who can somehow never just be helpful or try to solve a problem.  All I want is to see a GP and it's about something quite important.  It is so utterly demoralising.  I work hard all week, but can't access a basic service.  Why is Nexus still in charge of all these surgeries?

title: Good Practice
body: Was listened too and hopefully what was discussed will happen and Happy with the consultation very happy to see this doctor again.

title: Good experience
body:
Appointment was made two days after my request, on arrival I was directed to waiting room two, very short wait before being called. 
Overall experience was perfect. 
Thanks

title: I would not recommend this practice
body: After being sick and unable to keep any food or drink for 4 days and completing a e-consult form as is the only way to get an appointment it still took 2 more days for them to contact me and gave me an appointment for more than 25 days later.I had to go to A&E and when I raised a complaint they had the audacity to tell me that I was lucky as I. Other surgeries people wait 6 weeks for an appointment.Then they refused to do some blood test that were ordered by the hospital as a follow up,as some of my pancreatic levels were high.I never had a problem before but since Covid this surgery went downhill.

title: Good response
body: I contacted the surgery via internet and was given an appointment that morning. GP was a good listener and has referred me. Also had a blood test straight away

title: Helpful advice
body: I was seeking advice on how to proceed, given that I have covid. The doctor was very clear and took her time to talk to me. I was not given the impression that she was in a hurry to get to the next appointment, but rather wanted to make sure that I had the information that I needed.

title: Absolutely incredible care
body: I had an emergency situation and was initially seen by the paramedic at surgery who asked for a second opinion by the duty doctor, both the paramedic and the duty doctor were incredible, extremely professional and caring, I can’t thank them enough for their quick response and duty of care.

title: Rude and uncaring staff
body: The staff at the reception is extremely rude and unprofessional. I came to a&e for a broken finger and they were chatting with each other and said I should have waited at the entrance (because they were still chatting). After one minute, when they finished their conversation, they called me at the reception. The lady at the reception was extremely rude and dismissive. I felt like I was bothering here. Also other nurses and staff is very rude, they treat you like you are a number. Awful experience, will never come here again

title: Could not fault
body:
Today I have spent time in Same day emergency unit, Staff couldn’t do enough to reassure my husband and myself.
We were offered and given refreshments, on more than one occasion, making this department feel friendly and relaxed.
There is a professional but reassuring atmosphere.
All the staff are happy to talk and laugh with the patients to relax them.

title: Very efficient
body: I went to Ophthalmology A&E at about 11.30am with a very painful eye. Within 2 hours I had been seen by two nurses and a doctor. The problem was diagnosed and I was given medication. Very efficient staff and dept.

title: A great service to the Fordingbridge community
body: I've seen three different doctors other than my registered GP since February 2023 and they have all given me a high level of professional expertise and I was seen very quickly. In the 32 years I have been with this practice the staff and GPs have always shown me dignity and respect.

title: Upsetting experiences
body: I struggle to access GP care due to previous traumatic experiences. I keep finding that staff are rude and speak harshly both over the phone and in person. When this happens I instantly panic and have to tell the person to stop as I need to leave. They then get worse and on three occassions have started actually shouting at me. I've never raised my voice or been rude and they know on my file I have panic attacks easily when attending medical care so I don't understand why they don't try and help me and instead just act like I'm being difficult. My PTSD is a disability and instead of being helped to access care I'm being almost blocked.

title: Well done
body: I visited the practice on 4th august with my elderly mother who was seen within the hour and had her wound attended to and prescribed antibiotics. Excellent service. However if our own surgery had helped us I would not have had to take my 86 year old mother all the way to Brighton to be seen. Top marks for the station practice and their staff.

title: Excellent
body:
My father had catarrh surgery at the CHEC Centre in Accrington.
He was very impressed with the whole process, from first contact with bookings team to the actual operation.
The surgeon was reassuring and happy to chat with him, making him feel like a valued individual as a posed to just another 'eye' on a production line of procedures. 
He experienced no pain at all during the surgery and only minimum discomfort a few hours afterwards. 
Thank You CHEC.

title: Kind and caring
body: My dad went to A&E with a suspected stroke and the care he got from all the staff there was amazing. Despite being extremely busy and working long shifts and under huge pressure, the triage nurse and the A&E nurses and doctors ensured that he was well looked after and got all the tests and scans that he needed. They were all so kind and thorough and admitted him as an inpatient for further tests, explaining to us exactly what was happening and why which was very reassuring. The staff on Hawthorn ward were also amazing and we cannot thank them all enough for the kindness, care and treatment he received whilst in hospital. Before discharge the doctor explained the treatment plan and what follow up care he would get in detail and we are so grateful. NHS staff are truly special people who go above and beyond every day, doing their best to help patients in an underfunded service and in very difficult and challenging conditions. You all deserve a massive pay rise as you are one of the country’s most valuable assets. Thank you!

title: A Very Pleasant Experience
body: From the moment I arrived at Spa medica, I was made to feel welcome and important.  From the guy on the door to the surgeon who carried out my procedure,  everyone I had dealings with showed genuine interest and empathy.  I was very impressed and although I was very nervous when I arrived, I soon became relaxed.  I am very pleased with the outcome of my operation.   My only other comment is that coathooks  would be very usefull in the toilet cubicles.

title: Excellent service
body: Thank you so much for this absolutely confidential and free service! I cannot express how grateful i am for the staff and the treatment. I had medical abortion and didn’t even have to go to the clinic, everything was done over the phone and post, quite promptly, which helps to reduce the stress of already uneasy situation. Thank you for giving us the choice and all your support!

title: Exemplary
body:
The Drs are very proactive and accommodating. Quick appts always available even on short notice.

Reception team are welcoming and friendly. highly recommended.

title: MRI Scan
body:
:  I had an MRI scan at the department of radiology at 11.40 on 27th June 2023 for which I was very pleased with the staff on duty and was pleased that it was on time as per my appointment.
At the end of the scan I asked when I could expect to hear about my results.
I was told that I should hear in about a fortnight.
It is now the 5th August and following several calls to the Lister including 01438 314333.
I have also visited my GP surgery to ask to speak to any doctor about my situation but was told by the receptionist that my GP would not be informed.
I am now in suspense and very concerned and stressed out about how to move forward as my arm and hand is still in considerable discomfort permanently despite having regular physio appointments.

readBy.name: East and North Hertfordshire NHS Trust

title: Very good practice
body:
Friendly extremely efficient though 
Dealt with my problem and gave further help booking further appointments with physio etc.

title: Really good
body: I called on in some distress and was seen straight away with extreme efficiency and kindness and my problem was resolved !

title: No procedure
body: After being referred to CHEC in November 2022, I received an appointment in March 2023.  On arrival I was informed that YAG laser treatment was not suitable for my eye condition and I would be referred to a hospital.  In May I discovered that this referral had not been made.  It was subsequently made only for me to be informed that the waiting time was six months.  As a result I paid for a private consultation and received YAG laser treatment at a cost to myself. I emailed CHEC on July 4th asking for an explanation and have not yet received a reply despite following up the email with two phone calls.  Myself, my optician and the consultant I visited are all interested as to why I could not have had the procedure in March at no cost to me.

title: Fantastic Clinic
body: The care here is second to none. The staff are very friendly and helpful. If I ever fall ill again there is no other clinic I’d rather stay at.

title: Service
body: Healthshare provided good communication before the appointment and on the day good dxa scan appointment. Very good overall service

title: Great experience
body: I was able to talk to the doctor and she gave me all the information I needed. Felt I was listened to and felt important.

title: Good practice
body: Staff friendly and pleasant surroundings. Doctor listened to me and understood my condition. Not overcrowded in the waiting area.

title: Good service
body: Saw the healthcare assistant for bloods. I had abscess on my leg and I needed the dressing changing.  Even though I wasn't booked in for that, she changed the dressing for me.

title: Brilliant
body: I've been with this medical practice for a lot of years and from then till this day can't say brilliant they are.. OK so the phones are a bit dodgy but I've had no trouble with this the doctors are exceptional as are the clinicians.. The receptionists are very welcoming and helpful.. Keep up the good work. And thank you.

title: Well looked after.
body: Treated with patience and empathy by the doctor.  Given time to go through all my concerns. His particular doctor for me is a joy to deal with. She’s thorough and keeps me updated with blood tests results and hospital appts results.

title: Great service Cardiac Investigation Department
body:
Want to compliment lovely Main Entrance receptionist , kind nurse from ward 16 who helped me find ECG team. 
Appointment was timely and well organised.
Technician was friendly, professional and polite. She wasted no time during ECG investigation.
Special thank you to administrator who made neurodivergent ppl friendly letter and highlighted key information on it. Much appreciated and helpful.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Best practice in winsford
body: I have been with Weavervale surgery from day one and believe they provide the best service we have in winsford . I have heard difficulties with other doctors surgeries in the area which I don’t experience. Weavervale are so helpful, caring and really try to book you in for a matter needed that day.I had a telephone appointment recently with our long standing family doctor and he took the time to listen , which I really appreciated

title: burnley is a brilliant hospital kind and caring
body: went to burnley hospital had polyps removed on 04/08/2023  and everyone from the cleaners and domestics and receptionists nurses doctors consultants were so helpfull and kind and caring and from my arrival and first  seeing the receptionists it was only 5 mins later that a nurse took me to the endoscomy ward she was so kind and helpfull she answered all my questions to perfection giving me so much useful information I told her I did not want any pain relief or sedation she said if I wanted or needed any pain relief or  gas and air  I could still have it in case I changed my mind, then when I was in theatre she sat by me and held my hand and she kept me so reassured and feeling safe asking if I was OK then the doctor who performed the endoscopy was so brilliant I never asked for or needed any pain relief or sedation or gas and air because  I was never in pain and the only discomfort was when he put c02 in its like feeling bloated and feeling like you need to pass wind  I think the c02 is so he has more room to take out the polyps and see everything more clear, and as I watched everything he was doing on the big tv monitor it took my mind of any discomfort and it helped  the time go by so quickly then after I was took to the ward and given a nice cup of tea and a nice sandwich then another kind nurse told me everything I needed to know and about things like how there could be blood leaking for a while from the procedure but if there is a lot like half a cup full I would need to ring some contact numbers  and she gave me even more really good advice as well,  so anyone having any doubts about having any polyps removed please go to burnley hospital you will be treated like a friend rather than just a number I am 71 years old and been to many hospitals like preston royal and chorley but burnley is by far the the best by a country mile so thank you burnley hospital  for really caring about my feelings of trepidation and making me feel safe and treating me like a friend may God bless you all for the wonderful kindness and  service you gave to me I wish you all good health and happiness in your precious lives for the years ahead kind regards jimmy

title: Friendly and helpful
body: I had cataract surgery August 2023. Every member of staff went out of their way to welcome me to Ward 1 and put me at ease. The nursing staff, theatre staff and the staff in the recovery room were all so friendly and professional. I felt very confident that I was having the best treatment. I live in Otley and it was good to be able to use a local facility. No worries now about having my second cataract removed!

title: Ward 1
body: Very impressed with everyone in this clinic. Sent there from a&e promptly. Everyone was polite and helpful. Good follow up.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Difficult new system
body: Tried to book gp appointment as advised by hospital but found the receptionist unhelpful as was told only way was to use the new anima system. Found this difficult and stressful, not fit for purpose. No success, have given up! Still they should find things easier when they have managed to kill off most of their patients from lack of help!

title: Great practice
body: I'm happy with the service which I had from the receptionist, paramedic and GP to sort my problem. Was quick service. They were friendly and professional.

title: Medicine review
body: Good professional friendly service. Every thing medical was reviewed to my satisfaction. Time was taken to make sure I that my medicines were doing what was required for me.

title: 5 day week
body: Why is this practice not open at the weekend? It is nigh on impossible to get an appointment to see anyone unless you are unemployed, retired or work night shift. Even when you manage to get an appointment it sometimes so far off as to render it useless

title: Great service
body: Understanding, gentle, concerned.  The doctor I saw had made sure she'd checked on my.history beforehand so didn't have to explain it all again.  Very professional approach, wanted the outcome for what was best for me

title: Maternity is terrible
body: Nobody picks up the call in maternity department. Telephone consultation was in week 16, we are in week 19, nobody calls or takes the call. We went to hospital and they said somebody will call.

title: Professional and supportive
body:
I had a great experience during my day case procedure under the Gynae Department. I felt reassured and supported from the outpatient department right to the day of my operation.
The Gynaecologist, Anaesthetist, Nurses and the Theatre staff were friendly, professional, supportive and reassuring.
Overall a positive experience for me.
I am very grateful to all for looking after me.

title: Unacceptable slow
body: I think having to wait for nearly two weeks for a medical certificate, that last for three weeks is totally unsatisfactory.

title: A very nice place
body: Warm friendly very helpful staff, and a very reasuring surgical staff, as medical facilities go  this one  is top,s.

title: Extremely professional
body:
Following considerable pressure from me on my GP practice, I was given the opportunity of an appointment for an ultrasound at Healthshare within 2 weeks, as opposed to the 22 weeks NHS waiting list.
Prompt, professional service - quite remarkable and a wholly refreshing attitude.

title: Great service
body: I had a blood test on a Wednesday, the doctor called me with the result on Thursday and I was referred to and saw a Consultant team a week later. The service was brilliant throughout.

title: Amazing service
body:
after leaving my old surgery after concerns I joined Charnwood Surgery, to my amazement I was offered appointments that suited my working hours and was even seen on a Sunday.  Recently my daughter also joined the practice. She was also seen quickly on a Sunday as she works full time. It is so refreshing to now visit or call this surgery knowing that I a not going to be met with the usual " call back at 8am tomorrow for an appointment for that day" ( which historically meant that I would call at 8am wait in line for approx 40 mins to be cut off just as I reached position number 1!)
I wish I had joined this practice sooner.  All the staff are super helpful and friendly... just how GP surgeries used to be.  Carry on the good work Charnwood Surgery!

title: Nurse and Doctor poor service
body:
I understand that in a&e there is a lot of pressure for the staff, but I am not a person that just attends a&e for no reason I have not attended for many years, to be told that if I leave it will cost my gp£100, is not something that should be told to a sick person. I work and pay taxes in this country, I even work for the nhs myself and then to get to the assessment area and waited patiently for a Dr for 5 hours get seen and reviewed and then the Dr has to then speak to their senior to know how to deal with my case, waited for 1hour. When I then saw the Dr and just asked if there was any update. I get a attitude 'the Dr is with a sick patient' because I believe now I am being judged because the Dr don't feel my problem is big. Was it so difficult to come back 10minutes after you said you will speak to your senior and say my colleague is really busy at the moment so It may take a while, so I am seeing other people as you will have to wait. What has happened to communication. Then I see another patient older than me in pain so I ask if the patient had something for then pain and they had not even helped this older person, the patient had their own pain medication and as they was unable to walk I got them some water so they could help themselves to take their own tablets and then I went to the nursing desk to alert the nurse in charge and was dismissive 'oh they are all getting tablets' then the nurse turned back to the computer and chatting to the computer and ignored me when I was making them aware the patient had taken some painkillers so they could document. 

I understand there is pressure, in jobs but if you don't feel the compassion and care to people then why do the job, that is all apart of the experience of feeling better. People showing empathy can ease patients when in that already stressful environment. 

I am not saying all the staff are like that but there are a few amongst them and they need to communicate more effectively, people have to wait but explain to them. Advise them you will be number 30 in the line, when you go round to the assessment area you are just told to sit down and wait. They have a line system which they are aware which patients are next based on checking in, why can they not tell people at least they have something. Then you see them and say your going to get back to them, just inform the patient that whilst you are waiting, for their stuff they will be seeing others in between.  So people are well informed. They just treat people inhumane no proper communication, it was so sad to sit there and watch. Especially the older patient we was there the same time and no one offered a drink of water nothing. The service is extremely poor I am so sorry to say that and that job is not for people that cannot work under pressure because they start to treat people like they are a burden. A lot of Dr's and nurses lack compassion. The love of helping people and treating people with kindness is gone its just a job very sad.

title: Great Service
body:
Can t fault the service given.
Staff were excellent, nothing was to much trouble. 
Kept well informed throughout the stay, and everything was explained clearly.
Food was great to, just an excellent service
Can t thank you enough.

title: Confused
body:
Seems like doctor does no prep on why they are calling me and seem to have no idea how to use technology so can't see blood test results 

I find baffling why it takes months for a gp to abllod test and results reviewed.  When this should take no more than 48-72 hours maximum and should be given a detailed information

title: A professional and proactive service.
body:
We moved to Whitwick 2 years ago. We joined Whitwick Health Practice on the recommendation of friends. it is without doubt the most proactive, professional doctors practice that we have ever used.
The reception staff, clinical staff and Doctors are extremely efficient and friendly. I have no hesitation in highly recommend the practice.

title: Very poor communication
body:
I have received some terrible news and require an urgent procedure.
However, can I get to talk to someone - no!
Good Hope not only do not answer their telephone but also do not reply to your voicemail!
Absolutely shocking and wholly unacceptable … patients are distressed and need to talk to someone for reassurance!

Why are you not answering or responding to calls?!?!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Really poor administration
body: Have recently had the unenviable task of dealing over the phone with the surgery, whilst I have no complaints with the GP's, the administration is appalling 15m to connect on 31/8 and 20m to be cut off today and this just to make a courtesy call about cancelling a procedure

title: Cannot connect with anyone
body: I have a telephone consultation appt next week with connect health. I have received a text and an email to complete a questionnaire before my appt. I have tried via email & text following the links given and I either get a server error message or the screen where you input your medical number, email etc just refreshes and clears everything I've filled in when I hit submit. I have also tried to log on using the NHS login and get the same server error message. I tried ringing Connect Health on their 0800 number which doesn't connect to anyone. I tried to ring my local hospital pain clinic and get referred to a bt voicemail. Having read recent views I hold out no hope that I will be successful in getting the very much needed help I'm hoping to get. What a waste of time & money with an unusable service!

title: Very welcoming practice
body: I attended this morning for a blood test. The two receptionists were very welcoming and the Nurse who took my blood was excellent, well done. I will certainly re visit for future blood tests, thankyou.

title: Cardiology Incapable of giving "Urgent"…
body: Despite being labeled an "urgent" case by the cardiologist 4 weeks ago, the hospital is unable to even give a date for a CT scan. Long waiting times are bad enough but to not know when that will be puts your life on hold waiting for Cardiology.  As I contact Cardiology I've been told it will be 2 weeks, then 4 weeks then 4-5 weeks  and today I was told "we aren't giving out any appointment dates".  This is simply awful.  The lack of communication from Cardiology is beyond unethical.  Why does Cardiology treat their patients so badly? Surely a date can be given even if it is way out there?  How many patients have died waiting for these appointments?

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Impatient Attitude
body: Whenever I called the surgery, whoever the receptionist was, the person always sounded impatient and angry. It wasn't that my problems were not solved. I had a medical condition of anxiety. Yet, they always spoke with an impolite attitude even while I was still talking. I could not figure out that was about my foreign identity or that they just do that to everybody.

title: Disappointing online prescription service
body: I can't fault the surgery itself, it's a great practice. But 3 out the last 4 times I've requested a repeat prescription online they've got it wrong. Each time requesting 2 of an item and only receiving 1! Clearly stating on the form that 2 are needed but they never call or contact me to check or clarify. I wonder if they ever read them properly!

title: Too many mistakes
body:
Spoke to a “care navigator “ who took details of blood tests that my London based neurologist wanted 

Fast forward to the day of the blood test half the tests not requested and incorrect clinical background 

Won’t be too long before they make a life threatening error with a patient

title: Nhs there if you need it in a emergency
body: I was admitted in a ambulance and from Aand e,Ward n2,c7 and dispach lounge l ws treated brilliantly. Every one l encountered were lovely even under extreme violence and racism from other patients. The only improvement lcan suggest would bea notice in the dispatch  lounge saying it takes several hours toget your doctors letter and drugs. Thanks Peter

title: Exemplary Practice
body:
After being a generally well individual, I recently had cause to visit the practice on a number of occasions to help with an ongoing issue. I have been able to get appointments relatively promptly and received excellent support from clinicians who clearly are very knowledgeable and empathetic. The support staff have been equally helpful - particularly on my most recent visit where I was unfortunately late - whilst patently my own fault, the lady at reception was in no way rude - despite being well within her rights to be so, especially when our GP services are so stretched. The GP was equally understanding and just reinforces the excellent service I've had from this practice.

I've had medication dispensed and the dispensary could not be any more helpful. I've been patients at other practices in the past, but they've in the whole been inferior experiences to those had at Peninsula Practice.

title: Absolutely disgusting service
body: We ordered our medication nearly a week  ago and still they have not even put the request through to the GP. Considering we only have two tablets left they said they can not do anything about this and we need to wait considering our health issue

title: Poor System
body: Nothing against staff who are usually very helpful. I do think,however, the new booking system is appalling. You can longer go to the surgery to make an appointment...although the receptionist will fill in the form for you I don’t think this is acceptable as it doesn’t actually make the appointment. Not everyone has access to either a computer or smart phone which makes this system useless to them. From my point of view it was much better when you could book an appointment online or actually speak to a person and not have to wait more than an hour hanging on to be told you were number 3 in the queue and having to wait a further 45 mins before being put through. I appreciate it’s a new system which it will take time to get used to but don’t feel it’s a very acceptable system. As I said before I have no complaints against the staff just the system.

title: Adequate practice
body: Was seen on the day I needed the appointment which was made online and I find it is too difficult to make a telephone appointment

title: I recommend this practice
body: Called at 08:00, was No.21 in queue after just 10 minutes, got through to a lovely receptionist, she was very efficient. Helped to arrange a phone call then a home visit on the same day. Blood test done and all questions answered with another phone call later in the day. Very happy with the service and advise this practice gave my elderly relative.

title: Thoroughly professional (and very welcome!)
body: I was fortunate enough to get an appointment at Healthshare Norwich. From the very first contact to completion of the procedure, everyone was extremely helpful and thoroughly professional. Just hope now that the procedure works. Thanks once again.
